intro: Tulipa vitellina, commonly known as the yellow tulip, is a species of flowering plant in the family Liliaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, often with a distinctive orange or red base. Tulipa vitellina is a perennial bulbous plant that blooms in early spring, adding vibrant color to gardens. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and botanical collections.
